column4: Help: My system (ubuntu dapper) updated grub before I rebooted last, on reboot the grub menu would not show. I am booted with knoppix live cd. How can I fix grub from this?
grub menu is disabled then?  Or what?
I dont know exactly, I guess so
you can push esc to get to the grub menu?  your computer boots fine?
No, im booted with a knoppix live cd. The grub menu wont show
right, but because the menu won't show doesn't mean it wont boot normally.
ok, it probably boots, but the menu is gone.
it just says 'insert diskette press enter' or something to that effect
in the grub configuration, there's an option fo rit.  /boot/grub/menu.lst, comment out the "hiddenmenu" line
It's saying I cannot save it, read only file system.
How can I mount it to read-write?
You should just boot normally and change it that way.
you can push escape when the grub menu is hidden to see it.
I tried that, it just says "insert boot disk and press enter"
